title: Ptah
summary: Ptah /ˈtɑː/[1] (Ancient Egyptian: ptḥ, reconstructed [piˈtaħ]; Ancient Greek: Φθά; Coptic: ⲡⲧⲁϩ)[2][note 1] is an ancient Egyptian deity, a creator god[3] and patron of craftsmen and architects. In the triad of Memphis, he is the father of Nefertem. He was also regarded as the father of the sage Imhotep.
